name: Basic Vanilla Cake
headline: Basic Vanilla Cake
recipeIngredient: 2 sticks unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more for the pans
3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for the pans
1 1/4 cups whole milk (or 3/4 cup heavy cream mixed with 1/2 cup water)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter two 9-inch-round cake pans and line the bottoms with parchment paper; butter the parchment and dust the pans with flour, tapping out the excess.

Whisk 3 cups flour, the baking powder and salt in a bowl until combined. Beat 2 sticks butter and the sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Reduce the mixer speed to medium; beat in the eggs, one at a time, scraping down the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla. (The mixture may look separated at this point.) Beat in the flour mixture in 3 batches, alternating with the milk, beginning and ending with flour, until just smooth.

Divide the batter between the prepared pans. Bake until the cakes are lightly golden on top and a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Transfer to racks and let cool 10 minutes, then run a knife around the edge of the pans and turn the cakes out onto the racks to cool completely. Remove the parchment. Trim the tops of the cakes with a long serrated knife to make them level, if desired.

review.reviewBody: Because of the density of the cake i was inspired to use it as the base of a brownie recipe! I made the batter and separated it into two bowls, where i then added strawberry puree to one half, and melted salted caramel chocolate to the other half. From there i marbled it and added just a touch more flour to get a brownie batter consistency. Marble the batters together in a pan and bake. Delicious chocolate dipped strawverry brownies! Thank you for this easy and easily customizable recipe!

I love this cake. Using butter makes the cake denser, which many people complain about.  But this is exactly like the homemade cakes I grew up with, dense and not overly sweet, not like box or store bought cakes that you can mush into a goo ball.  I appreciate a cake with substance.

Very easy cake recipe basic to use. You can add your own taste to this. So the people complaining are just not using their imagination and adding their own spin onto it. For mine I added cinnamon, nutmeg, cream cheese, butter bits bottom of the pan along with cinnamon on bottom. Also added just a bit of fresh orange rined and squeezed just half the orange. Its very good!
Take a simple cake mix and add other things to it to make it your taste.
I hope I develop dissociative amnesia from the PTSD I got after taking a bite into this horrible abomination. Actually the worst cake I’ve ever tasted. Do NOT make this.

Basically, a box cake mix is a better option if you want cake. I found it to be flavorless and dense. It was also strangely dry but moist (like cornbread consistency).  I won't have a problem tossing the left overs instead of fighting my inner cake goddess for the scraps as I had hoped. It made a depressing day, more depressing. :'(
It was a good cupcake, crispy on the top and soft on the inside. It wasn't like cornbread at all. I loved it so much I will make a unicorn cake with it. Thank you food network!
